intro: Crenulluma collenetteae, commonly known as the Collenette's crenulate, is a rare and unusual plant species native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring a crenulate or scalloped edge that distinguishes it from other members of the plant family. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories where it can receive indirect sunlight. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits containing minute seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Crenulluma collenetteae is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
